title: 3 Easy Ways to Loop YouTube Videos on Repeat

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. It has an icon that resembles a red rectangle with a white 'play' triangle in the middle. YouTube is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . You cannot loop just a segment of the video using this method. To loop just part of a video, jump to Looping Part of a Video .

steps.title: Navigate to a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a video. Tap the magnifying glass in the top-right corner and enter keywords to search YouTube. Tap a video to open its watch screen.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Additional settings.
steps.content: Tap Additional settings . This is at the bottom of the pop-up menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Loop video.
steps.content: Tap Loop video . The switch will turn on. You can also loop a playlist . Just navigate to a playlist, and then tap the two arrows icon in the control box.

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com in your browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com in your browser. This will open the YouTube homepage. You don't need to log in unless you want to view content that's restricted to 18-and-over accounts. If you do need to log in, click Sign in in the upper-right corner of the page, then enter your email address and password. You cannot loop just a segment of the video using this method. To loop just part of a video, jump to Looping Part of a Video .

steps.title: Navigate to a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a video. Enter keywords in the top field to search YouTube. Click a video to open it.

steps.title: Right-click inside the video.
steps.content: Right-click inside the video. This will open a drop-down menu. If you're using a Mac, you'll need to control-click . Make sure that you do this on the video itself and not an ad.

steps.title: Click Loop.
steps.content: Click Loop . It's at the top of the drop-down menu. You'll see a checkmark appear next to the Loop option before the drop-down menu disappears. The video will repeat continuously until you close the video or turn looping off. To turn looping off, right-click the center of the video playback and click Loop again.

steps.title: Go to https://looptube.io in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://looptube.io in a web browser. If you just want to loop a segment of a YouTube video instead of the entire video, you can use LoopTube, a free web-based tool. This will work on any device, including your phone or tablet.

steps.title: Open the YouTube video in LoopTube.
steps.content: Open the YouTube video in LoopTube. To do this, you'll need the URL of the YouTube video you want to loop. Here's what to do: To get the URL, open the video on YouTube (either in your web browser or in the YouTube mobile app), click or tap Share below the video, then select Copy or Copy Link . To paste it into LoopTube, delete the example URL from the field. Right-click, control-click, or long-press the box and select Paste .

steps.title: Select the part of the video you want to loop.
steps.content: Select the part of the video you want to loop. Below the video, you'll see a pink slider. Drag the boxes on the left and right sides of the slider to select only the part of the YouTube video you want to loop.

steps.title: Click the white triangle at the bottom to start looping.
steps.content: Click the white triangle at the bottom to start looping. The selected part of the video will now play over and over again until you stop the video or navigate away from LoopTube.
